abstract: Fox and the Spanish-language television network Telemundo win the rights to broadcast the 2018 and 2022 World Cups in the United States for about $1 billion; the record sum demonstrates the steady and diverse growth in popularity of soccer in America.
snippet: For a record amount of about $1 billion, the deal shows the soaring growth of soccer in the United States.
lead_paragraph: For a record amount of about $1 billion, the deal shows the soaring growth of soccer in the United States.

headline.main: Fox and Telemundo Win U.S. Rights to World Cups
headline.print_headline: $1 Billion World Cup TV Deal Reflects Soccer’s Rise in U.S.
headline.seo: Fox and Telemundo Win U.S. Rights to 2018 and 2022 World Cups
